meanings.definition: A group of people or vehicles moving forward in an orderly fashion, especially as part of a ceremony or festival.
meanings.sent1: During the parade, the processions of dancers and musicians brought joy to the spectators.
meanings.sent2: The royal wedding included a grand procession through the streets.
meanings.sent3: The procession of ducks wearing tiny hats was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The procession of stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The colorful procession of balloons filled the sky with wonder.

meanings.definition: The action of moving forward in an orderly fashion, especially as part of a ceremony or festival.
meanings.sent1: The slow procession of ants carrying food to their nest fascinated the children.
meanings.sent2: The procession of students into the auditorium marked the beginning of the graduation ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The procession of penguins waddling to the water looked like a funny parade.
meanings.sent4: The procession of thoughts in her mind led to a brilliant idea.
meanings.sent5: The procession of cars in rush hour traffic seemed never-ending.
